flashcards.meaning: To succeed in doing or finishing something
examples: She accomplished her goal of running a marathon.

flashcards.meaning: Something that happens as a result of an action
examples: The consequences of his decision were significant.

flashcards.meaning: To try to reach an agreement through discussion
Able to be trusted or depended on
examples: She is a very reliable employee.

grammar.title: Present Perfect
grammar.meaning: Links past to present; experiences, changes, unfinished time

examples.english: I have visited Paris three times.
examples.translation: A life experience up to now.

examples.english: She has just finished her homework.
examples.explanation: Present perfect with 'just' for recent past

grammar.notes: Key words: ever, never, just, already, yet, for, since

grammar.title: Conditional - First (Real)
grammar.meaning: Real/possible future situations and their results

examples.english: If it rains, I will take an umbrella.
If you study hard, you will pass the exam.

practice.question: What does 'accomplish' mean?
practice.explanation: Accomplish means to successfully complete or achieve something.

practice.question: Complete: I ___ (never/visit) Japan before.
practice.explanation: Use present perfect with 'never' for life experiences up to now.

practice.question: Complete: If she ___ (work) hard, she will succeed.
practice.explanation: First conditional: If + present simple, will + verb

games.title: Conditional Builder
games.description: Arrange words to create correct conditional sentences

questions.sentence: If I have time, I will help you.
questions.correctAnswer: If I have time, I will help you.
